What is Bleacher Nation Fantasy?
Bleacher Nation Fantasy is a real-money daily fantasy sports platform that specializes in pick'em-style contests where users predict over/under on player stats, competing for cash prizes up to 100x the entry fee. 

Unlike traditional sports betting apps, BN Fantasy bills itself as a skill-based fantasy platform with fast real-time scoring, expert insights from Bleacher Nation writers, and up-to-date data including injury news. 

Where is Bleacher Nation Fantasy Legal?
Bleacher Nation Fantasy is legal in 21 states plus Washington, DC. 

That full list is: Alaska, California, District of Columbia, Florida, Georgia, Illinois, Kansas, Kentucky, Minnesota, Nebraska, New Mexico, North Carolina, North Dakota, Oklahoma, Oregon, Rhode Island, South Dakota, Texas, Utah, West Virginia, Wisconsin, Wyoming

Bleacher Nation Fantasy Betting Markets
Bleacher Nation Fantasy offers betting markets on major US professional and college leagues including the NFL, NBA, MLB, NHL, UFC, College Football, and Tennis. It's versatile year-round, with heavy emphasis on football and basketball during their respective seasons.

Supported sports markets at BN Fantasy include:

Sport

NBA	Points, assists, rebounds, 3-pointers

NHL	Goals, assists, shots on goal
UFC	Significant strikes, takedowns, fight outcomes
College Football	Passing/rushing yards, TDs
Tennis	Games won, aces, sets

Big changes have hit the Valley for the Phoenix Suns in the 2025‚Äì26 NBA season. After a frustrating and underwhelming 2024‚Äì25 run, the front office hit the reset button, starting with a blockbuster trade that sent Kevin Durant packing and a fresh hire in new head coach Jordan Ott.

Despite low preseason expectations, the Suns are doing surprisingly well, sitting in seventh place in the Western Conference and winning eight of their last ten games with a 24-16 record. If the Suns' roster continues to deliver, Phoenix could fight its way back into playoff contention for the first time since 2021. We'll provide all of the latest futures odds from Arizona sports betting operators throughout the 2025-26 season.

Latest Suns Odds & Futures: Playoffs, Championship, & More
Early odds didn't favor the Suns, but a few big wins have improved their outlook. After finishing 11th in the Western Conference last season and missing the Play-In tournament, the team is counting on a new coaching staff and a revamped roster to spark a turnaround and build the foundation for a more sustainable, competitive future.

‚≠ê Odds to Win Pacific Division:	+200 (33.3% chance)
üö® Odds to Make Playoffs:	-370 (78.7% chance)
ü•á Odds to Win Western Conference:	+15000 (0.7% chance)
üèÜ NBA Championship Odds:	+35000 (0.28% chance)
üèÄ Devin Booker MVP Odds	OTB
Odds provided by DraftKings Sportsbook

Current 2025-26 Suns NBA Finals Odds
The Suns' NBA Finals odds have improved since the start of the season at DraftKings Arizona. But Phoenix is still a clear long shot to win the NBA championship, with sportsbooks showing little confidence in a deep playoff run. With first-time head coach Jordan Ott at the helm, a new starting five, and a younger, unproven roster, Phoenix is embracing a full reset as it looks to build for the future rather than chase immediate title contention. The Suns‚Äô roster has delivered so far, and they sit second in the Pacific Division, just one game behind the Los Angeles Lakers.

There are various Arizona sports betting apps with 2025-26 odds for the Phoenix Suns and every other NBA team.

Suns Chances to Make Playoffs and Win NBA Championship
The Suns' roster is centered around rising young stars alongside veterans Devin Booker and Dillon Brooks. Despite this shakeup, sportsbooks have pegged Phoenix as underdogs across the board. Big wins, however, have improved the Suns‚Äô odds to make the playoffs and win the division. They are embarking on a six-game road trip from January 13‚Äì23, then return home on January 25.

‚≠ê Win Pacific Division:	33.3% (+200)
üö® Make NBA Playoffs:	78.7% (-370)
ü•á Win Western Conference:	0.66% (+15000)
üèÜ Win NBA Championship: 	0.28% chance (+35000)
‚úÖ Last Updated: 	January 17, 2026
The 2024-25 Suns starting 5 were one of the best when healthy. After missing both the Play-In Tournament and the playoffs, the Phoenix Suns wasted no time reshaping their roster this offseason. Injuries have been a familiar challenge for Phoenix, and they‚Äôve surfaced again this season. Jalen Green has been sidelined since November, but his return could be coming soon, as he‚Äôs already started taking live reps. The Suns are aiming for him to be back around mid-January.

Where Can I Bet on the Phoenix Suns?
You can legally bet on the Suns and the entire NBA at all licensed Arizona sportsbooks as long as you‚Äôre 21 or older and within state lines. Beyond futures like NBA Champion, conference winner, division winner, and major awards, you can also bet on individual Suns games. Here are a few notable sportsbooks with good Arizona sportsbook promos to get started on NBA betting:

How Many Times Have the Suns Won the NBA Championship?
None. They lost 4-2 to the Celtics in 1976, 4-2 to the Bulls in 1993, and 4-2 to the Bucks in 2021.

How Many Times Have the Suns Made the NBA Finals?
Three times, once when they were still relative newcomers to the NBA, again when Charles Barkley was leading the team, and recently when they held a 2-0 lead but lost the next four to Giannis Antetokounmpo and the Bucks.

How Many Times Have the Suns Made the Playoffs?
Phoenix has made the playoffs 33 times, with the longest non-playoff drought happening from 2010 until 2020, ending that drought by making a run to the NBA Finals.

Arizona closed the season with a disappointing 80-82 record, finishing 4th in the NL West and missing the playoffs once again. Looking ahead to 2026, manager Torey Lovullo will return for his 10th year, while key players Corbin Carroll, Ketel Marte, and Gabriel Moreno will be back in the lineup. With a solid core in place, the priority will be building bullpen depth and finding consistency to finally close out games.

Check back throughout the offseason and season for the latest Arizona Diamondbacks odds to make the playoffs, win the World Series, and more.

The Arizona Diamondbacks finished ninth in the National League with a below-.500 record and missed the postseason, ending 5.5 games back of the final Wild Card spot. The Los Angeles Dodgers have the best odds to win the NL in 2025.

What Are the Arizona Diamondbacks NL West Odds?
The Arizona Diamondbacks finished in fourth place in the NL West. The Dodgers won the division with a 93-69 record. Below are the final NL West standings for 2025:

Los Angeles Dodgers 93-69
San Diego Padres 90-72
San Francisco Giants 81-81
Arizona Diamondbacks 80-82
Colorado Rockies 43-119
Can the Diamondbacks Make the Playoffs?
The Diamondbacks‚Äô playoff chances fluctuated all season at sportsbooks across the AZ sports betting market. Injuries hit the bullpen hard in 2025, with season-ending losses to Corbin Burnes, Justin Martinez, and A.J. Puk.

Looking ahead, the D-backs are focused on next season, with All-Stars Corbin Carroll and Ketel Marte leading the lineup. Pitcher Corbin Burnes is aiming for a midseason return, and Tyler Locklear is expected to remain a key part of the roster.

Arizona Diamondbacks World Series, National League History
Pro baseball was introduced to the state of Arizona in 1998 when the Arizona Diamondbacks kicked off their first inaugural season. The Diamondbacks have played in the NL West in every season that they've been a part of MLB.

Have the Arizona Diamondbacks Won a World Series?
The Arizona Diamondbacks have won the World Series once, in 2001. It was just their fourth season as a franchise, and they defeated the New York Yankees four games to three.

How Many Times Have the Diamondbacks Won the National League?
The Diamondbacks have won the National League pennant twice, once in 2001 and again in 2023. They beat the Atlanta Braves 4-1 to earn the NLCS title in 2001 and defeated the Philadelphia Phillies 4-3 in the 2023 NLCS.

How Many Times Have the Diamondbacks Made the Playoffs?
In 26 seasons, the Diamondbacks have made the postseason seven times. Their most recent appearance was in 2023, when they won the NLCS and lost to the Texas Rangers in the World Series.

Marvin Harrison Jr. Odds: Offensive Player of the Year and MVP
Below are odds per DraftKings Arizona. Other sportsbooks may carry slightly different odds.

üèÜ MHJ to Win Offensive Player of the Year:	+5000
üèÜ MHJ to Win MVP:	+40000
Harrison's odds to win 2025-26 Offensive Player of the Year are much shorter than his odds were to win Rookie of the Year. An Arizona Cardinals player has never won Offensive Player of the Year or MVP. QB Kyler Murray did take home Offensive Rookie of the Year in 2019. You can imagine how a payout would look pairing a winning MVP ticket with any of the available AZ sports betting promotions being offered today.

Who Is Favored to Win Offensive Player of the Year in 2025?
The favorite to win OPOY is Philadelphia Eagles running back Saquon Barkley at +500. Barkley took home the award in 2024.

Who Won Offensive Play of the Year in 2024?
The 2024 NFL Offensive Player of the Year winner was running back Saquon Barkley from the Philadelphia Eagles. Barkley rushed for over 2,000 yards in the 2024-25 season.

NFL Offensive Player of the Year Winners History
The NFL has handed out awards for Offensive Player of the Year since 1972. Only four wide receivers have won OPOY in history.

Offensive Player of the Year Winners: Past 10 Years

What the Moneyline Tells Us
The moneyline favored the Lakers. Los Angeles got the victory at home. As for the total, it was under 229.5 points, with the final scoring totaling 203 points.

History of Phoenix Suns LA Lakers Games
Since the 2010-11 season, the Lakers and Suns have met in the postseason only one time: in 2021 when the Suns won their first-round series 4-2. Phoenix also defeated Los Angeles 4-1 in 2007 and 4-3 in 2006 in a pair of first-round series.

Suns Record vs. LA Lakers
The teams have played each other 340 times over the decades, with the Lakers winning 193 of them. The longest winning streak by one of these teams against the other was seven in a row ‚Äî three times by the Lakers and once by the Suns.

All-Time Best Suns-Lakers Games
These teams are not rivals in the traditional sense, but they have had plenty of memorable games, aside from the phantom timeout game from earlier this season.

Game 1: May 6, 2006
The Lakers led this first-round series 3-1, and Phil Jackson-coached teams had been 44-0 when holding a lead in a postseason series. But the Suns won the final three games, including a 121-90 blowout at home that was made possible by Tim Thomas hitting a game-winning 3 at the end of Game 6.

Game 2: April 29, 2007
En route to winning this series 4-1, Steve Nash finished one assist shy of Magic Johnson's record for most assists in a playoff game, finishing with 23 in a 113-100 victory in Game 4.

Game 3: June 3, 2021
Devin Booker had the game of his life as the Suns clinched this first-round series 4-2, scoring 47 points with 11 rebounds in a 113-100 victory as the Suns won the first of three West series before losing to Milwaukee in the finals.

If you take the time to read and understand the following breakdown, you will be successful and make money with the Sharp Money Pro tool...

Here is how and why it works:

There are 2 types of books: sharp (aka smart) and soft (aka beatable)
Novig and ProphetX are peer to peer betting exchanges and are extremely sharp. Exchanges have market makers, betting syndicates & trading firms setting lines on their platforms. These exchanges have ONLY grown more popular & active...
These exchanges are extremely sharp when they are highly liquid (have a lot of activity). When this is the case, you want to bet ALL "crossed market bets" (or arbitrage plays) to them.
By definition, if there's arbitrage (aka risk-free betting opportunity), one SIDE of the arbitrage opportunity HAS to be a profitable (+EV) bet. If you can get BOTH outcomes to ensure a profit, then one SIDE of the arbitrage play is an insanely profitable wager.
The insanely profitable side is going to be on the soft (aka beatable) book. You want to bet on this side, commonly MGM, FanDuel, PrizePicks, Underdog Fantasy, DraftKings, Hard Rock, Dabble, when they are "crossed" with NoVig and ProphetX.
The more "liquid" or active the market is, the higher confidence the bet you are placing is profitable.
All that YOU have to do is place the bets, which is EXTREMELY easy with "one click bet" that takes you right to it. The Sharp Money Pro tool handles all the hard work for you - you just have the click the "one click bet" button.
